title: Hikaru Kitagawa
text:
is a Japanese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She plays for <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Ladies">Albirex Niigata</a>. She played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Kitagawa was born in <a href="Kanazawa">Kanazawa</a> on May 10, 1997. After graduating from <a href="JFA%20Academy%20Fukushima%20LSC">JFA Academy Fukushima</a>, she joined <a href="Urawa%20Reds%20Ladies">Urawa Reds</a> in 2015. She played as regular right side back from first season. However her opportunity to play decreased from 2017. In September 2018, she moved to <a href="Albirex%20Niigata%20Ladies">Albirex Niigata</a>.
National team career.
Kitagawa played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Japan U-17 national team</a> at <a href="2014%20FIFA%20U-17%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2014 U-17 World Cup</a> and <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan U-20 national team</a> at <a href="2016%20FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2016 U-20 World Cup</a>. Japan won the championship in 2014 and 3rd place in 2016. In 2017, she was selected <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> for <a href="2017%20Algarve%20Cup">2017 Algarve Cup</a>. At this competition, on March 1, she debuted against <a href="Spain%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Spain</a>. She played 5 games for Japan in 2017.
